intro: Chupalon cordifolium, commonly known as the heart-leaf plant, is a flowering species native to the high altitudes of the Himalayas. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its aromatic, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-white flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Its leaves are heart-shaped, hence the species name *cordifolium*, and are often used in traditional medicine. The plant thrives in cool, moist environments and is adapted to thrive in rocky, well-drained soils.
